definition: dialectal equivalent of 怎麼|怎么[zen3 me5]

sentences.english: The acrobat 's feat took the audience's breath away.
sentences.chinese: 杂技演员的惊险动作使观众为之咋舌。

sentences.english: It reaches two hundred and seventeen meters which is an astonishing eight hundred and ninety feet.
sentences.chinese: 它高达217米，即890英尺，真是令人咋舌。

sentences.english: But the visual spectacle is even more astounding.
sentences.chinese: 但是视觉奇观更是令人咋舌。

sentences.english: The records he refers to are indeed astounding.
sentences.chinese: 黄锐提到的艺术品拍卖记录确实令人咋舌。

sentences.english: On the blue laque pen, the serifs on the letters are terrible.
sentences.chinese: 在蓝色漆笔上字母的细纹真的令人看来咋舌。

sentences.english: China's car exports dropped by a stunning 50% in 2009.
sentences.chinese: 2009年，中国汽车出口下降50%，令人咋舌。

definition: to click one's tongue in wonder (idiom)/to be astonished
to be startled/to be shocked/to be amazed
to exclaim in admiration/a gasp of surprise
tongue-tied/unable to speak (out of surprise, embarrassment etc)
to be surprised/to be amazed/to be stunned
see 心驚膽戰|心惊胆战[xin1 jing1 dan3 zhan4]
to whine about hardships/to complain of one's bitter lot/to complain/to grumble
lit. heart alarmed, body leaping (idiom); fear and trepidation in the face of disaster
